BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 The Ray docs package reference is now showing ray.init(*args, **kwargs) instead of the full list of parameters. Links between master and the last release below.
 This shouldn't necessarily block the 1.2.0 release, but we shouldn't update the latest/stable docs until we fix this.
 Master: <denchmark-link:https://docs.ray.io/en/master/package-ref.html>https://docs.ray.io/en/master/package-ref.html</denchmark-link>
 
 Latest: <denchmark-link:https://docs.ray.io/en/latest/package-ref.html>https://docs.ray.io/en/latest/package-ref.html</denchmark-link>
 
 Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS):
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 Please provide a short code snippet (less than 50 lines if possible) that can be copy-pasted to reproduce the issue. The snippet should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments):
 If the code snippet cannot be run by itself, the issue will be closed with "needs-repro-script".
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.

comments_0.comment_text:
I haven't looked into this much but I think sphinx is confused by this decorator:
 
 
 from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/commit/c4e273920f517b18c99fbabca49135dd6e30e683>c4e2739</denchmark-link>
 
 not really sure if there's a workaround that doesn't involve reverting that commit... <denchmark-link:https://github.com/richardliaw>@richardliaw</denchmark-link>
  what docs-building package is used? e.g., sphinx, napoleon
